headline: Sweet French Toast
description: Make this sweet French toast recipe for a tasty treat that will satisfy your sweet tooth. Crumbled cornflakes add interesting texture to each bite!
name: Sweet French Toast
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk milk, eggs, maple syrup, vanilla, and cinnamon together in a medium bowl. Add crumbled cornflakes and stir to combine.
Working in batches, soak 1/2 of the bread slices in the mixture for about 2 to 3 minutes.
Heat oil in a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Cook soaked bread slices in the hot skillet until dark golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Repeat to soak and cook remaining bread.
Sprinkle hot French toast with confectioners' sugar. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Loved 10/10
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??

My family loved it! You will most definitely need more batter. I doubled my batch. 
When you sprinkle in the cornflakes (I used Frosted Flakes, because why not?!) Just sprinkle enough for each slice at a time, or the flakes will end up all at the bottom soaking up your batter mixture and become a soggy mess at the bottom.
I just put the flakes in a Ziploc baggy and beat them to smithereens!!
Easy, delicious recipe.
The french toast was delicious. I will be using this recipie again.

This was SO good - I’m not usually a French toast fan but my husband is and we both agreed it was restaurant quality. Only note: this says it’s for 8 slices - maybe my bread was super absorbent, but it was a stretch to make 4. All of the liquid was already soaked up!
Very good

I did like the crunch from the cornflakes but the idea of soaking these for 2-3 minutes is unrealistic unless you are using a baking dish or something that fits all of your bread. I doubled the mix and put like 7 pieces of bread in and it soaked the ENTIRE MIX UP. So if you need to double or can’t fit all of your pieces in the batter at once you really need to portion the mix out. I am sure the fact that the pieces soaked up all of that mix significantly affected the flavor so I can only give this 2 stars.
First off.. double the batch. I used thin bread slices and 4 soaked it all up! The corn flakes MADE it!! I used Frosted Flakes and it was scrumptious!!!!
Great flavor! I ended up needing 5 eggs and more of everything else for 6 slices of bread. Not sure how 3 eggs would be enough for 8 slices-Especially soaking each slice for 2 minutes!
Fantastic! Wife said it was the best French Toadt she’s ever had!
Very good! I substituted the sugar for whey and used sprouted bread for a nice supplement of protein. I also used crumbled blueberry Cheerios giving it a nice hint of fruit.

Made this recipe using loaf sandwich bread that needed to be eaten before going bad. Didn’t use cornflakes because I didn’t have them, but it was still delicious! Only dipped the bread in the egg mixture for a couple of seconds on each side rather than soaking them. Fried them in melted butter and poured maple syrup on top. It was more like dessert and so very delicious!
It turned out too soggy. I am a novice at cooking, but I followed the recipe exactly, except I did remove the crust. Any tips?

I made this with our local bakery's cinnamon swirl bread and cut into nice thick slices. It made 4 slices so I added a couple more eggs and milk with a dash of syrup and made 2 more. It came out nicely crisp and moist. French toast is always made best with day old or drier bread.
I did not make mine stale first and need to do that next time. Also with brioche bread soaking it makes it fall apart and too gooey inside. In any case it was delicious and easy to make!
I made this with only one serving and i almost ran out of liquid . I would round up most of the liquid measurements .
My husband loved these. I used whole grain bread, soy milk and granola instead of corn flakes. He said, they feel healthy :) Great recipe for a fast yet delicious breakfast!
I don't eat French Toast but my kids do and they really enjoyed this version. I used Sy's Challah bread from this site which made it extra special. Thank you!!
I didn't eat the french toast I just made it but my younger brother said it was very good. It seemed average to me. The milk to egg ratio seemed to work well in it. 4 stars.
Great recipe! Doesn't taste all that different from regular french toast, but still good. I used grape nuts instead of cornflakes and thought it worked well.

I guess I was expecting more of a unique french toast, but really, this tastes like french toast! My family couldn't even tell it was a new recipe (despite the tiny cornflake coating). It IS very good but everyone already thought this was my french toast recipe. Since I don't think it tastes better than my recipe, I won't go through the extra effort to make this again. Still, very good.

I guess I was expecting more of a unique french toast, but really, this tastes like french toast! My family couldn't even tell it was a new recipe (despite the tiny cornflake coating). It IS very good but everyone already thought this was my french toast recipe. Since I don't think it tastes better than my recipe, I won't go through the extra effort to make this again. Still, very good.
This was great. I used regular white bread but only dipped the pieces of bread in the egg mixture. Excellent brunch for my husband & I this morning.
I didn't enjoy this recipie b/c the first piece of bread soaked up at least half the mix. The two remaining breads that i was able to moderate the servings a little better were still not good.
A good overall recipe. I will use thick bread when I make again-regular white bread fell apart-maybe I soaked it too long. I added another egg, but the batter only was enough for 5 slices.

The best french toast I had ever tasted! I didn`t even use the vanilla extract and only put a tablespoon of syrup in, and they still came out delicious. The confectioners` sugar made them perfectly sweet enough. And the idea of putting cornflakes in is ingenious. ;)
This is really good. It is the closest I have come to copying some terrific French Toast from a Vegas Breakfast Buffet.
